--- title: "Adding complexity" format: revealjs: author: "STAT 20: Introduction to Probability and Statistics" height: 900 width: 1600 theme: ../../assets/slides.scss multiplex: false transition: fade slide-number: c incremental: false center: false menu: false highlight-style: github progress: false code-overflow: wrap title-slide-attributes: data-background-image: ../../assets/stat20-hex-bg.png data-background-size: contain --- ## Agenda - Quiz - Concept Questions - Break - Practice: Cities # Concept Questions ## Into the mind of the cat ![](frank.png){fig-align="center" height="700"} This is Frank ## Feline sleeping patterns ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
03:00
``` ::: ::: :::{.poll} How many hours does the model predict Frank will sleep each day? ::: lm(formula = hours ~ cuteness + food_eaten + is_indoor_cat, data = cats) ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` (Intercept) cuteness food_eaten is_indoor_catTRUE 8.00 0.10 -0.01 2.00 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 4 Ã— 5 name hours cuteness food_eaten is_indoor_cat 1 castiel 12 9 175 TRUE 2 frank 18 10 200 TRUE 3 luna 19 9.5 215 FALSE 4 luca 10 8 218 FALSE ``` ::: ::: ## Which is the most appropirate transformation? ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
01:00
``` ::: ::: :::{.poll} Which is the most appropriate non-linear transformation to apply to `Time being pet`? ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](slides_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## Is this a linear model? ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
02:00
``` ::: ::: :::{.poll} Suppose I fit a 3rd degree polynomial model to predict the number of hairs on a cat from the length of the cat. Is this a linear model? ::: ## Is this the correct formula? ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
01:00
``` ::: ::: Suppose I fit a linear regression model $$ \widehat{y} = b_0 + b_1 \cdot x $$ :::{.poll} Do following formulas tell me the linear regression coefficients? ::: $$ b_1 = \frac{s_y}{s_x} \text{cor}(x, y) $$ $$ b_0 = \overline{y} - b_1 \cdot \overline{x} $$ ## Is this the correct formula? ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
02:00
``` ::: ::: Suppose I fit a linear regression model $$ \widehat{y} = b_0 + b_1 \cdot x_1 + \dots + b_d \cdot x_d $$ :::{.poll} Do following formulas tell me the linear regression coefficients? ::: $$ b_1 = \frac{s_y}{s_{x_1}} \text{cor}(x_1, y) $$ $$ \vdots $$ $$ b_d = \frac{s_y}{s_{x_d}} \text{cor}(x_d, y) $$ $$ b_0 = \overline{y} - \sum_{j=1}^d b_j \cdot \overline{x}_j $$ # Handout

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {

      // dispatch for htmlwidgets
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for reveal
    if (window.Reveal) {
      window.Reveal.addEventListener("slidechanged", function(event) {
        fireSlideChanged(event.previousSlide, event.currentSlide);
      });
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
